001package com.technototes.library.control;
002
003import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
004import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
005import java.util.function.DoubleSupplier;
006
007import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Gamepad;
008
009import com.technototes.library.general.Enablable;
010import com.technototes.library.general.Periodic;
011
012/**
013 * A class to extend gamepads from, it does the internal processing for you.
014 *
015 * @param <T> The class for the button components on the gamepad
016 * @param <U> The class for the axis components on the gamepad
017 * @author Alex Stedman
018 */
019public class GamepadBase<T extends ButtonBase, U extends AxisBase> implements Periodic, Enablable<GamepadBase<T, U>> {
020    private boolean enabled = true;
021    // normal gamepad
022    private Gamepad gamepad;
023    /**
024     * The button objects for the XBox game controller
025     */
026    public T a, b, x, y, start, back;
027    /**
028     * The button objects for the PS4 game controller
029     */
030    public T cross, circle, square, triangle, share, options;
031    /**
032     * The button objects for both the XBox and PS4 controllers
033     */
034    public T leftBumper, rightBumper, dpadUp, dpadDown, dpadLeft, dpadRight, leftStickButton, rightStickButton;
035    /**
036     * The axis objects
037     */
038    public U leftTrigger, rightTrigger, leftStickX, leftStickY, rightStickX, rightStickY;
039    /**
040     * The stick objects
041     */
042    public GamepadStick<U, T> leftStick, rightStick;
043    /**
044     * The dpad object
045     */
046    public GamepadDpad<T> dpad;
047
048    // periodics to run
049    private Periodic[] periodics;
050    private Enablable<?>[] enablables;
051
052    private Class<T> buttonClass;
053    private Class<U> axisClass;
054
055    /**
056     * Creates a gamepad with these parameters
057     *
058     * @param g      The gamepad to base around
059     * @param bClass The class object passed for the button components (Should be the same as the one used for the class parameter T)
060     * @param aClass The class object passed for the axis components (Should be the same as the one used for the class parameter U)
061     */
062    public GamepadBase(Gamepad g, Class<T> bClass, Class<U> aClass) {
063        gamepad = g;
064        buttonClass = bClass;
065        axisClass = aClass;
066        try {
067            setComponents(g);
068        } catch (Exception e) {
069            e.printStackTrace();
070        }
071
072        leftStick = new GamepadStick<>(leftStickX, leftStickY, leftStickButton);
073        rightStick = new GamepadStick<>(rightStickX, rightStickY, rightStickButton);
074        dpad = new GamepadDpad<>(dpadUp, dpadDown, dpadLeft, dpadRight);
075        periodics = new Periodic[] {
076            a, b, x, y, start, back, leftBumper, rightBumper, leftTrigger, rightTrigger, leftStick, rightStick, dpad
077        };
078        enablables = new Enablable[] {
079            a, b, x, y, start, back, leftBumper, rightBumper, leftTrigger, rightTrigger, leftStick, rightStick, dpad
080        };
081    }
082
083    // to actually instantiate the objects
084    private void setComponents(Gamepad g)
085            throws InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, NoSuchMethodException, InvocationTargetException {
086
087        // buttons
088        // a=new T();
089        a = buttonInstance(() -> g.a);
090        b = buttonInstance(() -> g.b);
091        x = buttonInstance(() -> g.x);
092        y = buttonInstance(() -> g.y);
093        cross = a;
094        circle = b;
095        square = x;
096        triangle = y;
097
098        start = buttonInstance(() -> g.start);
099        back = buttonInstance(() -> g.back);
100        share = back;
101        options = start;
102
103        // bumpers
104        leftBumper = buttonInstance(() -> g.left_bumper);
105        rightBumper = buttonInstance(() -> g.right_bumper);
106
107        // dpad
108        dpadUp = buttonInstance(() -> g.dpad_up);
109        dpadDown = buttonInstance(() -> g.dpad_down);
110        dpadLeft = buttonInstance(() -> g.dpad_left);
111        dpadRight = buttonInstance(() -> g.dpad_right);
112
113        // left stick
114        leftStickX = axisInstance(() -> g.left_stick_x);
115        leftStickY = axisInstance(() -> g.left_stick_y);
116        leftStickButton = buttonInstance(() -> g.left_stick_button);
117
118        // right stick
119        rightStickX = axisInstance(() -> g.right_stick_x);
120        rightStickY = axisInstance(() -> g.right_stick_y);
121        rightStickButton = buttonInstance(() -> g.right_stick_button);
122
123        // triggers
124        leftTrigger = axisInstance(() -> g.left_trigger);
125        rightTrigger = axisInstance(() -> g.right_trigger);
126    }
127
128    // enums
129
130    /**
131     * Button enum for all buttons on gamepad
132     */
133    public enum Button {
134        A,
135        B,
136        X,
137        Y,
138        CROSS,
139        CIRCLE,
140        SQUARE,
141        TRIANGLE,
142        SHARE,
143        OPTIONS,
144        START,
145        BACK,
146        LEFT_BUMPER,
147        RIGHT_BUMPER,
148        LEFT_STICK_BUTTON,
149        RIGHT_STICK_BUTTON
150    }
151
152    /**
153     * Axis enum for all axis on gamepad
154     */
155    public enum Axis {
156        LEFT_STICK_X,
157        LEFT_STICK_Y,
158        RIGHT_STICK_X,
159        RIGHT_STICK_Y,
160        LEFT_TRIGGER,
161        RIGHT_TRIGGER
162    }
163
164    /**
165     * Returns a button
166     *
167     * @param bu The enum to choose which gamepad button to return
168     * @return The gamepad button that you choose with the enum
169     */
170    public T getButton(Button bu) {
171        switch (bu) {
172            case A:
173                return a;
174            case B:
175                return b;
176            case X:
177                return x;
178            case Y:
179                return y;
180            case CROSS:
181                return cross;
182            case CIRCLE:
183                return circle;
184            case SQUARE:
185                return square;
186            case TRIANGLE:
187                return triangle;
188            case SHARE:
189                return share;
190            case OPTIONS:
191                return options;
192            case BACK:
193                return back;
194            case START:
195                return start;
196            case LEFT_BUMPER:
197                return leftBumper;
198            case RIGHT_BUMPER:
199                return rightBumper;
200            case LEFT_STICK_BUTTON:
201                return leftStickButton;
202            case RIGHT_STICK_BUTTON:
203                return rightStickButton;
204            default:
205                return null;
206        }
207    }
208
209    /**
210     * Returns an axis
211     *
212     * @param as The enum for the axis that is wanted to be returned
213     * @return The chosen axis
214     */
215    public U getAxis(Axis as) {
216        switch (as) {
217            case LEFT_STICK_X:
218                return leftStickX;
219            case LEFT_STICK_Y:
220                return leftStickY;
221            case RIGHT_STICK_X:
222                return rightStickX;
223            case RIGHT_STICK_Y:
224                return rightStickY;
225            case LEFT_TRIGGER:
226                return leftTrigger;
227            case RIGHT_TRIGGER:
228                return rightTrigger;
229            default:
230                return null;
231        }
232    }
233
234    /**
235     * Returns a button as boolean (same as isPressed)
236     *
237     * @param bu The enum to specify which button to get as boolean
238     * @return The chosen button as boolean
239     */
240    public boolean getButtonAsBoolean(Button bu) {
241        return getButton(bu).getAsBoolean();
242    }
243
244    /**
245     * Returns an axis as double
246     *
247     * @param as The enum to specify which axis to get as double
248     * @return The chosen axis as double
249     */
250    public double getAxisAsDouble(Axis as) {
251        return getAxis(as).getAsDouble();
252    }
253
254    /**
255     * Returns an axis as boolean
256     *
257     * @param as The enum to specify which axis to get as boolean
258     * @return The chosen axis as boolean
259     */
260    public boolean getAxisAsBoolean(Axis as) {
261        return getAxis(as).getAsBoolean();
262    }
263
264    /**
265     * Returns the left stick
266     *
267     * @return The left stick on the gamepad
268     */
269    public GamepadStick<U, T> getLeftStick() {
270        return leftStick;
271    }
272
273    /**
274     * Returns the right stick
275     *
276     * @return The right stick on the gamepad
277     */
278    public GamepadStick<U, T> getRightStick() {
279        return rightStick;
280    }
281
282    /**
283     * Returns the Dpad object
284     *
285     * @return The dpad
286     */
287    public GamepadDpad<T> getDpad() {
288        return dpad;
289    }
290
291    /**
292     * Run the periodic functions for the controller (if the controller is enabled)
293     */
294    @Override
295    public void periodic() {
296        if (isDisabled()) {
297            return;
298        }
299        for (Periodic p : periodics) {
300            p.periodic();
301        }
302    }
303
304    /**
305     * Returns the encapsulated gamepad
306     *
307     * @return The gamepad
308     */
309    public Gamepad getGamepad() {
310        return gamepad;
311    }
312
313    /**
314     * @param b
315     * @return
316     * @throws InstantiationException
317     * @throws IllegalAccessException
318     * @throws NoSuchMethodException
319     * @throws InvocationTargetException
320     */
321    public T buttonInstance(BooleanSupplier b)
322            throws InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, NoSuchMethodException, InvocationTargetException {
323        return buttonClass.getConstructor(BooleanSupplier.class).newInstance(b);
324    }
325
326    public U axisInstance(DoubleSupplier d)
327            throws InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, NoSuchMethodException, InvocationTargetException {
328        return axisClass.getConstructor(DoubleSupplier.class).newInstance(d);
329    }
330
331    // rumble stuff
332
333    /**
334     * Run a bunch of "RumbleBlips"
335     *
336     * @param blips The number of blips
337     */
338    public void rumbleBlips(int blips) {
339        gamepad.rumbleBlips(blips);
340    }
341
342    /**
343     * Run a single "RumbleBlip"
344     */
345    public void rumbleBlip() {
346        rumbleBlips(1);
347    }
348
349    /**
350     * Rumble the gamepad for 'seconds'
351     *
352     * @param seconds The number of (fractional) seconds to rumble for
353     */
354    public void rumble(double seconds) {
355        gamepad.rumble((int) (seconds * 1000));
356    }
357
358    /**
359     * Is the gamepad rumbling
360     *
361     * @return true if the gamepad is rumbling
362     */
363    public boolean isRumbling() {
364        return gamepad.isRumbling();
365    }
366
367    /**
368     * Stop rumbling on the gamepad
369     */
370    public void stopRumble() {
371        gamepad.stopRumble();
372    }
373
374    /**
375     * Rumble for about 1/8th of a second
376     */
377    public void rumble() {
378        rumble(120);
379    }
380
381    /**
382     * Enable/disable the gamepad (and all potentially bound commands!)
383     *
384     * @param enable True for enabled, false for disabled
385     * @return the Gamepad (for chaining)
386     */
387    @Override
388    public GamepadBase<T, U> setEnabled(boolean enable) {
389        enabled = enable;
390        for (Enablable<?> enablable : enablables) enablable.setEnabled(enable);
391        return this;
392    }
393
394    /**
395     * Is the gamepad (and all bound commands from it!) enabled?
396     *
397     * @return true if it's enabled, false if it's disabled
398     */
399    @Override
400    public boolean isEnabled() {
401        return enabled;
402    }
403}
